definition: public/collectively owned/common/international (e.g. high seas, metric system, calendar)/make public/fair/just/Duke, highest of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/honorable (gentlemen)/father-in-law/male (animal)
to break/to snap/to cut off/to give up or abstain from sth/to judge/(usu. used in the negative) absolutely/definitely/decidedly

sentences.english: Let's not submit our disputes for arbitration.
sentences.chinese: 不要把我们的争论拿去公断。

definition: lit. right and wrong, crooked and straight (idiom); fig. merits and demerits/pros and cons
to determine right and wrong based on public opinion (idiom)/Public opinion will judge what's right and wrong.
pinyin: shi4 fei1 zi4 you3 gong1 lun4

definition: conducting business impartially (idiom); to act justly
to confess one's fault/to accept one's punishment
to decide/to make decisions/to take responsibility (for deciding)/to be in charge/to give sb justice
